key_responsibilities: assisting constituents by providing information and researching federal issues, answering questions on federal issues, directing constituents to appropriate state or local governments or community resources
writing memorandums for meetings
answering casework correspondence, meeting with constituents and serving as a liaison with federal, state and local agencies
controlling and processing constituent correspondence and cases; exercising judgment to determine the best course of action for individual cases

following district office casework policy and employing appropriate congressional casework tools, programs and resources, logging in all incoming and outgoing mail and incoming telephone calls relating to casework
screening and referring cases to other congressional district offices; continually screening active cases; maintaining up-to-date files on all cases
logging-in constituent comments and researching questions on federal policy, law or procedure
acting as a liaison to assigned constituency groups
representing the Congresswoman at meetings/events
driving and staffing the Congresswoman for various events, meetings and district office outreach activities
meeting attendance requirements
maintaining a good working relationship with the Congresswoman, staff and constituents
performing other duties as assigned by the District Director

good organizational skills, professional manner and appearance
good communications skills (written and verbal)
knowledge of Microsoft Office suite; proficiency in word processing and mail-merge
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
ability to drive a car – valid driver’s license

key_responsibilities: overseeing all operations of the district offices, including the development and implementation of policy objectives, strategies and operating plans
